item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; The Week Ahead - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; The Week Ahead - NEWSBTC

Here's what we are looking at in the bitcoin price for today's session. We are right at the beginning of a fresh week's worth of trading in the bitcoin price, and it's looking like we might get some interesting action going forward.

item.title: ASIC And Singapore Collaborate On Fintech and Bitcoin Regulation
item.description:
ASIC And Singapore Collaborate On Fintech and Bitcoin Regulation

It is worth noting how Christine Lagarde, the managing director of the IMF, personally invited Mr. Medcraft. Both parties met up earlier this year as the World Economic Forum in Davos, where the future of Fintech was discussed at length. Bitcoin and Fintech are two areas where regulation will play a major role in the coming years.

item.title: Bitcoin investors 'owed thousands' by struggling Australian exchange
item.description:
Bitcoin investors 'owed thousands' by struggling Australian exchange

Posted April 11, 2016 16:16:50 Australian-founded bitcoin exchange Igot appears on the verge of collapse, with dozens of customers and clients claiming to be owed hundreds of thousands of dollars. The company, which buys and sells bitcoins on behalf of customers, has for months been unable to completely deliver on those bitcoins or refund their money.

item.title: Bitcoin and Divorce: A Match Made in Heaven? - Bitcoinist.net
item.description:
Bitcoin and Divorce: A Match Made in Heaven? - Bitcoinist.net

There appears to be a new weapon in the battle for divorce by vindictive estranged partners: bitcoin. Yes, it turns out that bitcoin is causing a bit of a stir in the legal community. In many countries wealth isn't divided equally based on how much a person earns, but how much is contributed to the marriage.

item.title: Is mysterious billionaire inventor of Bitcoin about to reveal his identity?
item.description:
Is mysterious billionaire inventor of Bitcoin about to reveal his identity?

The secretive billionaire inventor of Bitcoin is preparing to finally reveal his identity, tech industry sources have claimed. A mysterious figure who used the false name Satoshi Nakamoto to launch a digital currency, which fuels a shadow economy worth billions of dollars, is understood to be planning to reveal his true identity in the coming days.

item.title: Bitcoin adress security questions
item.description:
Bitcoin adress security questions

I am trying to understand Bitcoin addresses, but it does not seem to be easy at all. As far as I know, a transaction uses one or more addresses as input and one or more addresses as output. Is this

item.title: Overstock CEO and Bitcoin Messiah Patrick Byrne Takes Medical Leave of Absence
item.description:
Overstock CEO and Bitcoin Messiah Patrick Byrne Takes Medical Leave of Absence

Overstock.com CEO and chairman Patrick Byrne has taken an indefinite medical leave of absence from the company. Byrne has a long history of medical problems after a long bout with cancer nearly 30 years ago. Due to the cancer and related heart problems, Byrne says, he has undergone more than 106 surgeries over the last three decades.

item.title: Blockchain won't kill banks: Bitcoin pioneer
item.description:
Blockchain won't kill banks: Bitcoin pioneer

Blockchain - the technology that underpins the cryptocurrency bitcoin - is unlikely to kill banks despite warnings from top industry executives, the chair of a bitcoin non-profit organization told CNBC on Monday. Last week, Andrey Sharov, a vice president at Russia's Sberbank, said banks would disappear by 2026 due to the rising use of blockchain technology.

item.title: A Donald Trump Presidency Would Increase Bitcoin Remittances To Mexico
item.description:
A Donald Trump Presidency Would Increase Bitcoin Remittances To Mexico

If it's not remittances , immigrants in the US will figure out a way to send their money home if they want to do so. For now, it's not going to be Bitcoin. But, if Trump does block remittances, you better believe that sooner than later increasing numbers of remitters will look into this blockchain technology.

item.title: Can Bitcoin Be Gold 2.0?
item.description:
Can Bitcoin Be Gold 2.0?

In my previous article ' Inflation: The Beast in the Cage' we discussed how central banks are purposefully manufacturing inflation in the hopes of countering the global economy's prevailing deflationary headwinds, and the ramifications this could have for fiat currencies (currencies issued and backed by central banks).
